short_summary: Drilling and Testing in Kuuguluk Riverbed
description: The Department of Natural Resources Canada has a requirement to provide technical and scientific research services in application of drilling, piezometer installation and instrumentation and hydraulic and CPT testing in the Kuugulk riverbed at Salluit, (Nunavik, Quebec). Any interested supplier must demonstrate by way of a statement of capabilities that it meets the following requirements: (1) Experience in the past 10 years conducting fieldwork direct push with lost tip piezometers installation to define the hydraulic heterogeneity profiles of a shallow granular aquifer; (2) Fieldwork single-well interference slug tests to assess vertical hydraulic conductivity; (3) Fieldwork piezocone soundings with real-time electrical resistivity measurement to assess the saline formation leaching. One team member must possess a graduate degree in the field of hydrogeology.
duration_in_months: You will be given the estimated contract duration on this contract when it is tendered or after awarding with the contract in the contract offer document.

full_summary:
# Notice of Contract Award
## Advanced Contract Award Notice
#### Reference Number: cb-299-39519420

* **Title:** Drilling and Testing in the Kuuguluk Riverbed, Salluit
* **Brief Description:** The Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) is seeking a contractor to provide drilling, piezometer installation, and instrumentation services in the Kuuguluk Riverbed at Salluit, Quebec.

* **Notice Details:**
  * **Publication Date:** April 29, 2024
  * **Tender Closing Date:** May 14, 2024, 2:00 pm
  * **Expected Contract Start Date:** September 25, 2024
  * **Expected Contract End Date:** March 31, 2025

* **Project Requirements:**
  * The contractor must have ten years of experience in conducting fieldwork in the following areas:
    1. Fieldwork direct push with lost tip piezometers installation to define hydraulic heterogeneity profiles of a shallow granular aquifer.
    2. Fieldwork single-well interference slug tests to assess vertical hydraulic conductivity.
    3. Fieldwork piezocone soundings with real-time electrical resistivity measurement to assess the saline formation leaching.
  * The contractor must have academic qualifications, with one team member holding a graduate degree in hydrogeology.

* **Contract Details:**
  * **Contracting Entity:** Natural Resources Canada (NRCan)
  * **Contact Information:**
    Vincent Gariépy, Procurement Advisor
    Email: [vincent.gariepy@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca](mailto:vincent.gariepy@nrcan-rncan.gc.ca)
    Phone: (819) 239-9895

* **Tender Documents:** The tender notice and all relevant documents are available at [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/37089/acan-nrcan-5000079626-%28182209.pdf](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/37089/acan-nrcan-5000079626-%28182209.pdf).
* **Trade Agreements:** The tender is not limited to Canadian suppliers, with access available to contractors under various trade agreements.
